intro: Saussurea tilesii subsp. tilesii, commonly known as the Tibetan saffron, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and tall, slender stems that bear yellowish-green flowers. The plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous regions. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
